thread.section_title: Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Times Square - UPDATED 2017 Hotel Reviews & Price Comparison (New York City) - TripAdvisor
thread.title: Reunion
thread.title_full: Reunion - Review of Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Times Square, New York City, NY - TripAdvisor

author: MarinaS6
title: Reunion
text:
I have ordered a hotel room via booking.com - King studio with sofa bed and kitchenette. We arrived to the hotel, checked it and went into the room. Then I realized that the room that we got was a queen not a king room.
So, I went and tried to get the right room - reception staff claimed that I made a mistake during my reservation but I clearly remembered that I did order the king room - we were 3 women staying in the hotel room so we needed a bigger room.
Finally, they said that they can only move us to a king room next day and will give me a discount of $25.00 for the 1st night. OK, nothing to do but to accept it. So, the first night at the hotel - when we pulled out the sofa bed, there was hardly any space to walk in the room! So, we were happy when we got in the king room â€“ at least there were more space there. Was nice to have kitchenette as well to have some food there.
Hotel itself:
Good location. Close to the park and everything. Breakfast all right, not too many healthy options. lots of people. But possible to get a table.
There is a coffee shop next to the hotel, all shops, MACY's mall close to it, Times Square, etc.
Sofa bed - almost impossible to sleep since the mattress is very old and bad. Bathroom is kind of small.
Wifi - all right.
General impression - average hotel. Good location.
